alert.note: Alert for Volusia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 16 at 4:09PM EDT until August 16 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following county, Volusia. * WHEN...Until 615 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 409 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Daytona Beach, Port Orange, Ormond Beach, New Smyrna Beach, South Daytona, Holly Hill, Ormond-By-the-Sea, Daytona Beach Shores, Daytona International Speedway, Daytona Beach Airport, Ponce Inlet, Ormond Beach Airport, Spruce Creek, Allandale, Wilbur By The Sea, Harbor Oaks, Samsula-Spruce Creek, New Smyrna Beach Airport and Glencoe. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
